intro: Galium parisiense var. gracile, commonly known as slender woodcrushers, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically valuable component of its native habitat.
